text: Everything was great, except I wish that I could've sat close to that special person. I love the hot tea. The soup was delicious, could've been hotter. I will recommend this place to all my friends. Happy dining!

Chez Lien is some sort of franchise. I've never been to any other location, but this one is quite good. Slightly upscale, meaning it's not a hole in the wall like some Vietnamese restaurants. But it's not fancy either. We like to sit next to the fish tank so the kids can watch the fish. They have kids' specials. My wife loves the curry chicken. This isn't a Pho house, so don't look for Phos or Buns. But grilled meat over rice is very good. Bring your own wine!  Price-wise I was between $ and $$. I would say $9-$14 meals before tax and tip.

Ce restaurant Vietnamien, c'est LE restaurant Vietnamien de Montréal!  Après plusieurs tentatives dans de nombreux restaurants Vietnamien (j'aime ça dire Vietnamien! lol!) de la ville, je peux affirmer avec certitude que c'est le meilleur, le plus beau, le plus propre, offrant un service courtois et en français par-dessus le marché! ;-)   Le buf grillé aux légumes sur nouilles croustillantes est tout simplement divin! Le bouillon dans lequel les nouilles baignent est goûteux et délicat. Les légumes sont toujours d'une fraîcheur incomparable et contrairement à bien des restaurants asiatiques de Montréal, la viande n'est pas remplie de "tirailles"!  Si vous voulez goûter les meilleurs rouleaux impériaux "ever", passez par Chez Lien, ils valent largement le détour. Je m'en voudrait de ne pas mentionner le duo poulet et buf grillés traditionnels. Marinez à la perfection, les morceaux de viandes reposent sur un lit de riz ou de vermicelles (au choix) accompagnés d'une petite salade croquante toujours agréable en bouche! ;-)  Le "apportez votre vin" est bien apprécié, tout comme la rapidité du service "take out". Que dire de plus que : Chez Lien - le meilleur Vietnamien de Montréal!

Very slow delivery... We called at 7:45pm Took one hour to get our food, almost 9pm. We called back they said the order was out for delivery, they called us back to hang up on us... We have to pay extra 2.50 for this slow slow delivery..

Simple and tasty, an overall good meal.   We were the only ones in the restaurant, which worried me slightly, but once the food started arriving, all fears were laid to rest. The soup was hot and flavorful, the salads were fresh, and the meats (steak, chicken, and shrimp) were grilled perfectly. Nothing fancy, just simple and good.  I would caution against the green tea ice cream (which I ordered based on favorable comments on another review site). It was obviously partially thawed then re-frozen giving it that awful gritty texture. It was like eating ice cream with a handful of sand mixed in. Yech.

This place has the worst pho ive possibly ever eaten! The soup tasted like water and the veggies were undercooked. I was legitimately confused on what i was eating and for the price of it, I should've went to the McDonalds next door. The service was so horrible that it would make you reconsider your life decisions. Dont go there if you dont want to experience dissapointment and confusion
La nourriture est bonne, le français des employés est "ok" sans plus ! Je le recommande tout de même !

With healthy restaurant options hard to come by, this place has become one of my neighbourhood favourites. Love their soupe aux legumes (vegetable soup). Simple, healthy and cozy on a cold day. Also love their grilled meat and vegetables on vermicelli noodles. Also like that you can bring your own wine and beer. Prices are also decent.

Delicious every time and the portions are perfect. Fast seating, service and payment. Bring your own wine. Accomodating if you want to combine different things on the menu etc. Combinaison C is the best.
Du vietnamien c'est du vietnamien. Il y a du vietnamien goûteux et du vietnamien non goûteux. Et bien, ce Chez Lien était tout simplement FADE!!!! Rien d'autre à dire.
Nourriture toujours très bonne, pas cher, mais service moyen, ils sont toujours pressés de servir, le repas arrive avant que la soupe soit terminée, peu jasant. .
